page.title: 10LITTLEPORT BOAT HAVEN
page.content:
The{marina}at Littleport was originally a short canal built from the River Ouse to the railway station, where barges containing carrots, potatoes etc. could be off-loaded.
Commercial trade on the river has ceased and boat owners use the River Ouse and its tributaries, the Cam, Lark, Wissey and Little Ouse, for recreation.Now 47 boats are permanently moored there, both privately owned and for hire. Most are {narrow boats}(Polly-Ann is 17 metres long) or cruisers, but 2 are{sailing {boats}(one called "Graculus" the bird from the story of Noggin the Nog)
There are chandlery and petrol/water pumps to service the up to 20 tourist and hire cruisers that call in daily.
